Reference guide¶

This manual details, for each module of cnwheat, the functions and objects included in cnwheat, describing what they are and what they do.

Contents

  • Reference guide
    • cnwheat package
      • cnwheat
    • cnwheat.simulation module
    • cnwheat.model module
    • cnwheat.parameters module
      • cnwheat.parameters
    • cnwheat.tools module
      • cnwheat.tools

cnwheat package¶

cnwheat¶

The model CN-Wheat.

CN-Wheat computes the CN exchanges in a wheat architecture. See:

  • cnwheat.simulation for the front-end of the model,
  • cnwheat.model for the equations of the model,
  • cnwheat.parameters for the parameters of the model.
copyright:Copyright 2014-2015 INRA-ECOSYS, see AUTHORS.
license:TODO, see LICENSE for details.

See also

Barillot et al. 2015.

class cnwheat.simulation.Simulation(delta_t=1)[source]¶

Bases: object

The Simulation class permits to initialize and run the model.

Use run() to run the model.

Parameters:
  • population (list) - the population <cnwheat.model.Population in the system.

LOGGERS_NAMES = {'derivatives': {<class 'cnwheat.model.PhotosyntheticOrganElement'>: 'cnwheat.derivatives.elements', <class 'cnwheat.model.HiddenGrowingZone'>: 'growthwheat.derivatives.HiddenGrowingZone', <class 'cnwheat.model.Plant'>: 'cnwheat.derivatives.plants', <class 'cnwheat.model.Phytomer'>: 'cnwheat.derivatives.phytomers', <class 'cnwheat.model.Axis'>: 'cnwheat.derivatives.axes', <class 'cnwheat.model.Organ'>: 'cnwheat.derivatives.organs', <class 'cnwheat.model.Soil'>: 'cnwheat.derivatives.soils'}, 'compartments': {<class 'cnwheat.model.PhotosyntheticOrganElement'>: 'cnwheat.compartments.elements', <class 'cnwheat.model.HiddenGrowingZone'>: 'growthwheat.compartments.HiddenGrowingZone', <class 'cnwheat.model.Plant'>: 'cnwheat.compartments.plants', <class 'cnwheat.model.Phytomer'>: 'cnwheat.compartments.phytomers', <class 'cnwheat.model.Axis'>: 'cnwheat.compartments.axes', <class 'cnwheat.model.Organ'>: 'cnwheat.compartments.organs', <class 'cnwheat.model.Soil'>: 'cnwheat.compartments.soils'}}¶
population = None¶

the population to simulate on

soils = None¶

The inputs of the soils.

soils is a dictionary of objects of type model.Soil:
{(plant_index, axis_label): soil_object, ...}
initial_conditions = None¶

the initial conditions of the compartments in the population and the soils

initial_conditions_mapping = None¶

dictionary to map the compartments to their indexes in initial_conditions

progressbar = None¶

progress bar to show the progress of the solver

show_progressbar = None¶

True: show the progress bar ; False: DO NOT show the progress bar

delta_t = None¶

the delta t of the simulation (in seconds)

initialize(population, soils)[source]¶

Initialize:

  • population,
  • soils,
  • initial_conditions_mapping,
  • and initial_conditions

from population and soils.

Parameters:
  • population (model.Population) - a population of plants.
  • soils (dict) - the soils of each axis. soils must be a dictionary with the same structure as soils.
run(start_time, stop_time, number_of_output_steps, odeint_mxstep=0, show_progressbar=False)[source]¶

Compute CN exchanges in population and soils from start_time to stop_time, for number_of_output_steps steps.

Parameters:
  • start_time (int) - The starting of the time grid (in seconds).
  • stop_time (int) - The end of the time grid (in seconds).
  • number_of_output_steps (int) - Number of time points for which to compute the CN exchanges in population.
  • odeint_mxstep (int) - Maximum number of (internally defined) steps allowed for each integration point in time grid. odeint_mxstep is passed to scipy.integrate.odeint() as mxstep. If odeint_mxstep = 0 (the default), then mxstep is determined by the solver. Normally, the mxstep determined by the solver permits to solve the current model. User can try to increase this value if a more complex model is defined and if the integration failed. However, take care that the origin of an integration failure could be a discontinuity in the RHS function used by scipy.integrate.odeint(), and that this discontinuity could be due to a bug in your model. To summary: if the integration failed, first check the logs.
  • show_progressbar (bool) - True: show the progress bar ; False: do not show the progress bar.
Returns:

Dictionary containing output information from the solver. This is the dictionary returned by scipy.integrate.odeint() as second output. See the documentation of scipy.integrate.odeint() for more information.
Returns Type:

dict
postprocessings()[source]¶

Compute:

  • intermediate variables (see Simulation:PLANTS_INTERMEDIATE_VARIABLES, Simulation:AXES_INTERMEDIATE_VARIABLES, Simulation:PHYTOMERS_INTERMEDIATE_VARIABLES, Simulation:ORGANS_INTERMEDIATE_VARIABLES, Simulation:ELEMENTS_INTERMEDIATE_VARIABLES and Simulation:SOILS_INTERMEDIATE_VARIABLES),
  • fluxes (see Simulation:PLANTS_FLUXES, Simulation:AXES_FLUXES, Simulation:PHYTOMERS_FLUXES, Simulation:ORGANS_FLUXES, Simulation:ELEMENTS_FLUXES and Simulation:SOILS_FLUXES),
  • and integrative variables (see Simulation:PLANTS_INTEGRATIVE_VARIABLES, Simulation:AXES_INTEGRATIVE_VARIABLES, Simulation:PHYTOMERS_INTEGRATIVE_VARIABLES, Simulation:ORGANS_INTEGRATIVE_VARIABLES, Simulation:ELEMENTS_INTEGRATIVE_VARIABLES and Simulation:SOILS_INTEGRATIVE_VARIABLES),

from _solver_output and format them to dataframes.

Returns:

dataframes of post-processing outputs at each scale:

  • plant (see Simulation:PLANTS_ALL_VARIABLES)
  • axis (see Simulation:AXES_ALL_VARIABLES)
  • metamer (see Simulation:PHYTOMERS_ALL_VARIABLES)
  • organ (see Simulation:ORGANS_ALL_VARIABLES)
  • element (see Simulation:ELEMENTS_ALL_VARIABLES)
  • and soil (see Simulation:SOILS_ALL_VARIABLES)
Returns Type:

tuple of pandas.DataFrame

cnwheat.model module¶

class cnwheat.model.Population(plants=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

The class Population defines the CN exchanges at the population scale.

A population must have one or several plants.

PARAMETERS¶

the internal parameters of the population

alias of PopulationParameters

plants = None¶

the list of plants

calculate_integrative_variables()[source]¶

Calculate the integrative variables of the population recursively.

class cnwheat.model.Plant(index=None, axes=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

The class Plant defines the CN exchanges at the plants scale.

A plant must have one or several axes.

PARAMETERS¶

the internal parameters of the plants

alias of PlantParameters

index = None¶

the index of the plant

axes = None¶

the list of axes

calculate_integrative_variables()[source]¶

Calculate the integrative variables of the plant recursively.

class cnwheat.model.Axis(label=None, roots=None, phloem=None, grains=None, phytomers=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

The class Axis defines the CN exchanges at the axes scale.

An axis must have:
  • one set of roots,
  • one phloem,
  • zero or one set of grains,
  • one or several :class:`phytomer<Phytomer>.
PARAMETERS¶

the internal parameters of the axes

alias of AxisParameters

label = None¶

the label of the axis

roots = None¶

the roots

phloem = None¶

the phloem

grains = None¶

the grains

phytomers = None¶

the list of phytomers

calculate_integrative_variables()[source]¶

Calculate the integrative variables of the axis recursively.

class cnwheat.model.Phytomer(index=None, chaff=None, peduncle=None, lamina=None, internode=None, sheath=None, hiddengrowingzone=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

The class Phytomer defines the CN exchanges at the phytomers scale.

A phytomer must have either:
  • one chaff,
  • OR one peduncle,
  • OR one lamina, one internode and one sheath.
PARAMETERS¶

the internal parameters of the phytomers

alias of PhytomerParameters

index = None¶

the index of the phytomer

chaff = None¶

the chaff

peduncle = None¶

the peduncle

lamina = None¶

the lamina

internode = None¶

the internode

sheath = None¶

the sheath

hiddengrowingzone = None¶

the hidden growing zone

calculate_integrative_variables()[source]¶

Calculate the integrative variables of the phytomer recursively.

class cnwheat.model.Organ(label)[source]¶

Bases: object

The class Organ defines the CN exchanges at the organs scale.

Organ is the base class of all organs. DO NOT INSTANTIATE IT.

PARAMETERS¶

the internal parameters of the organs

alias of OrganParameters

label = None¶

the label of the organ

initialize()[source]¶

Initialize the derived attributes of the organ.

calculate_integrative_variables()[source]¶

Calculate the integrative variables of the organ recursively.

calculate_d_fructan(conc_sucrose, conc_fructan, delta_t)[source]¶

Rate of fructan degradation (µmol C fructan g-1 mstruct s-1 * delta_t). Inhibition function by the end product i.e. sucrose (Bancal et al., 2012).

Parameters:
  • conc_sucrose (float) - Sucrose concentration in the hidden growing zone (µmol C g-1 mstruct)
  • conc_fructan (float) - Fructan concentration in the hidden growing zone (µmol C g-1 mstruct)
Returns:

Fructan degradation (µmol C g-1 mstruct)
Returns Type:

float

Unloading of amino_acids from phloem to roots integrated over delta_t. Amino acids are assumed to be co-transported along with the unloaded sucrose from phloem (using the ratio amino acids:sucrose of phloem).

Parameters:
  • unloading_sucrose (float) - Sucrose unloading (µmol C g-1 mstruct)
  • sucrose_phloem (float) - Sucrose concentration in phloem (µmol C g-1 mstruct)
  • amino_acids_phloem (float) - Amino acids concentration in phloem (µmol N g-1 mstruct)
Returns:

Amino acids unloading (µmol N g-1 mstruct)
Returns Type:

float
calculate_uptake_nitrates(conc_nitrates_soil, nitrates_roots, sucrose_roots, delta_t)[source]¶
Rate of nitrate uptake by roots integrated over delta_t.
  • Nitrate uptake is calculated as the sum of the 2 transport systems: HATS and LATS
  • HATS and LATS parameters are calculated as a function of root nitrate concentration (negative regulation)
  • Nitrate uptake is finally regulated by the total culm transpiration and sucrose concentration (positive regulation)
Parameters:
  • conc_nitrates_soil (float) - Soil nitrate concentration unloading (µmol N m-3 soil)
  • nitrates_roots (float) - Amount of nitrates in roots (µmol N)
  • sucrose_roots (float) - Amount of sucrose in roots (µmol C)
Returns:

Nitrate uptake (µmol N nitrates)
Returns Type:

float
calculate_s_amino_acids(nitrates, sucrose, delta_t)[source]¶

Rate of amino acid synthesis in roots integrated over delta_t (µmol N amino acids g-1 mstruct s-1 * delta_t). Bi-substrate Michaelis-Menten function of nitrates and sucrose.

Parameters:
  • nitrates (float) - Amount of nitrates in roots (µmol N)
  • sucrose (float) - Amount of sucrose in roots (µmol C)
Returns:

Amino acids synthesis (µmol N g-1 mstruct)
Returns Type:

float
calculate_export_nitrates(nitrates, regul_transpiration, delta_t)[source]¶

Total export of nitrates from roots to shoot organs integrated over delta_t. Export is calculated as a function on nitrate concentration and culm transpiration.

Parameters:
  • nitrates (float) - Amount of nitrates in roots (µmol N)
  • regul_transpiration (float) - Regulating factor by transpiration (mmol H2O m-2 s-1)
Returns:

Export of nitrates (µmol N)
Returns Type:

float
calculate_export_amino_acids(amino_acids, regul_transpiration, delta_t)[source]¶

Total export of amino acids from roots to shoot organs integrated over delta_t. Amino acids export is calculated as a function of nitrate export using the ratio amino acids:nitrates in roots.

Parameters:
  • amino_acids (float) - Amount of amino acids in roots (µmol N)
  • regul_transpiration (float) - Regulating factor by transpiration (mmol H2O m-2 s-1)
Returns:

Export of amino acids (µmol N)
Returns Type:

float
calculate_exudation(unloading_sucrose, sucrose_roots, sucrose_phloem, amino_acids_roots, amino_acids_phloem)[source]¶
C sucrose and N amino acids lost by root exudation integrated over delta_t (µmol C or N g-1 mstruct).
  • C exudation is calculated as a fraction of C unloading from phloem
  • N exudation is calculated from C exudation using the ratio amino acids:sucrose of the phloem
Parameters:
  • unloading_sucrose (float) - Sucrose unloading (µmol C g-1 mstruct)
  • sucrose_roots (float) - Amount of sucrose in roots (µmol C)
  • sucrose_phloem (float) - Amount of sucrose in phloem (µmol C)
  • amino_acids_roots (float) - Amount of amino acids in roots (µmol N)
  • amino_acids_phloem (float) - Amount of amino acids in phloem (µmol N)
Returns:

C exudated, N_exudated (µmol C g-1 mstruct, µmol N g-1 mstruct)
Returns Type:

float
calculate_mstruct_growth_cost(mstruct_C_growth, Nstruct_N_growth, delta_t)[source]¶

Parameters:

  • Nstruct_N_growth (float) - rate of N consumption for the growth of root mstruct (µmol N s-1)

total_mstruct_C_growth, total_mstruct_N_growth (µmol C, µmol N)
Returns Type:

float
calculate_s_cytokinins(sucrose_roots, nitrates_roots, delta_t)[source]¶

Rate of cytokinin synthesis integrated over delta_t (AU cytokinins g-1 mstruct s-1 * delta_t). Cytokinin synthesis regulated by both root sucrose and nitrates. As a signal molecule, cytokinins are assumed have a neglected effect on sucrose. Thus, no cost in C is applied to the sucrose pool.

Parameters:
  • sucrose_roots (float) - Amount of sucrose in roots (µmol C)
  • nitrates_roots (float) - Amount of nitrates in roots (µmol N)
Returns:

Cytokinin synthesis (AU g-1 mstruct)
Returns Type:

float
calculate_export_cytokinins(cytokinins, regul_transpiration, delta_t)[source]¶

Parameters:

  • regul_transpiration (float) - Regulating factor by transpiration (mmol H2O m-2 s-1)
Returns:

Cytokinin export (AU)
Returns Type:

float

Number of C in 1 mol of sucrose

Contribution of C in hexose mass

Mean contribution of carbon to structural dry mass (g C g-1 Mstruct)

Time (h) at which phloem loading switch from grain structure to accumulation of starch

Time (h) at which grains filling stops. (Bertheloot et al., 2011)

cnwheat.tools module¶

cnwheat.tools¶

This module provides tools to validate the outputs of the model CN-Wheat.

copyright:Copyright 2014-2015 INRA-ECOSYS, see AUTHORS.
license:TODO, see LICENSE for details.

See also

Barillot et al. 2015.

cnwheat.tools.OUTPUTS_INDEXES = ['t', 'plant', 'axis', 'metamer', 'organ', 'element']¶

All the possible indexes of CN-Wheat outputs.

exception cnwheat.tools.DataWarning(variable, keys)[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.UserWarning

No data to plot for a variable.

cnwheat.tools.plot_linear_regression(x_array, y_array, x_label='x', y_label='y', plot_filepath=None)[source]¶

Perform a linear regression of x_array vs y_array and create a plot showing the fit against the original data. If plot_filepath is not None, save the plot to a PNG file. Otherwise display the plot.

This is derived from http://www.landmap.ac.uk/index.php/Learning-Materials/Python-Scripting/6.4-Fitting-linear-equations#sthash.wDZ5zBrD.dpuf, which is: Copyright TODO

Parameters:

  • x_array (numpy.ndarray) - The x.

  • y_array (numpy.ndarray) - The y.

  • x_label (str) - The label of the axis ‘x’. Default is ‘x’.

  • y_label (str) - The label of the axis ‘y’. Default is ‘y’.

  • plot_filepath (str) - The file path to save the plot in.

    If None, do not save the plot.
Examples: 
>>> import pandas as pd
>>> modelmaker_output_df = pd.read_csv('modelmaker_output.csv') # 'modelmaker_output.csv' must contain at least the column 'Sucrose_Phloem'
>>> cnwheat_output_df = pd.read_csv('cnwheat_output.csv') # 'cnwheat_output.csv' must contain at least the column 'Sucrose_Phloem'
>>> plot_linear_regression(modelmaker_output_df.Sucrose_Phloem,
                           cnwheat_output_df.Sucrose_Phloem,
                           x_label='modelmaker_{}'.format('Sucrose_Phloem'),
                           y_label='cnwheat_{}'.format('Sucrose_Phloem'),
                           plot_filepath='compare.png')
cnwheat.tools.plot_cnwheat_ouputs(outputs, x_name, y_name, x_label='', y_label='', title=None, filters={}, plot_filepath=None, colors=[], linestyles=[], explicit_label=True)[source]¶

Plot outputs, with x=`x_name` and y=`y_name`.

The general algorithm is:

  • find the scale of outputs and keep only the needed columns,
  • apply filters to outputs and make groups according to the scale,
  • plot each group as a new line,
  • save or display the plot.
Parameters:

  • outputs (pandas.DataFrame) - The outputs of CN-Wheat.

  • x_name (str) - x axis of the plot.

  • y_name (str) - y axis of the plot.

  • x_label (str) - The x label of the plot. Default is ‘’.

  • y_label (str) - The y label of the plot. Default is ‘’.

  • title (str) - the title of the plot. If None (default), create a title which is the concatenation of y_name and each scales which cardinality is one.

  • filters (dict) - A dictionary whose keys are the columns of outputs for which we want to apply a specific filter. These columns can be one or more element of OUTPUTS_INDEXES. The value associated to each key is a criteria that the rows of outputs must satisfy to be plotted. The values can be either one value or a list of values. If no value is given for any column, then all rows are plotted (default).

  • colors (list) - The colors for lines. If empty, let matplotlib default line colors.

  • linestyles (list) - The styles for lines. If empty, let matplotlib default line styles.

  • plot_filepath (str) - The file path to save the plot. If None, do not save the plot but display it.

  • explicit_label (bool) - True: makes the line label from concatenation of each scale id (default).
    • False: makes the line label from concatenation of scales containing several distinct elements.
Examples: 
>>> import pandas as pd
>>> cnwheat_output_df = pd.read_csv('cnwheat_output.csv') # in this example, 'cnwheat_output.csv' must contain at least the columns 't' and 'Conc_Sucrose'.
>>> plot(cnwheat_output_df, x_name = 't', y_name = 'Conc_Sucrose', x_label='Time (Hour)', y_label=u'[Sucrose] (µmol g$^{-1}$ mstruct)', title='{} = f({})'.format('Conc_Sucrose', 't'), filters={'plant': 1, 'axis': 'MS', 'organ': 'Lamina', 'element': 1})
cnwheat.tools.setup_logging(config_filepath='logging.json', level=20, log_model=False, log_compartments=False, log_derivatives=False)[source]¶

Setup logging configuration.

Parameters:
  • config_filepath (str) - the file path of the logging configuration.
  • level (int) - the global level of the logging. Use either logging.DEBUG, logging.INFO, logging.WARNING, logging.ERROR or logging.CRITICAL.
  • log_model (bool) - if True, log the messages from cnwheat.model. False otherwise.
  • log_compartments (bool) - if True, log the values of the compartments. False otherwise.
  • log_derivatives (bool) - if True, log the values of the derivatives. False otherwise.
cnwheat.tools.compare_actual_to_desired(data_dirpath, actual_data_df, desired_data_filename, actual_data_filename=None)[source]¶

Compare actual data to desired data. Raise an assertion if actual and desired are not equal up to RELATIVE_TOLERANCE or ABSOLUTE_TOLERANCE.

Parameters:
  • data_dirpath (str) - The path of the directory where to find the data to compare.
  • actual_data_df (pandas.DataFrame) - The computed data.
  • desired_data_filename (str) - The file name of the expected data.
  • actual_data_filename (str) - If not None, save the computed data to actual_data_filename, in directory data_dirpath. Default is None.

class cnwheat.tools.ProgressBar(bar_length=20, title='', block_character='#', uncomplete_character='-')[source]¶

Bases: object

Display a console progress bar.

bar_length = None¶

the number of blocks in the progress bar. MUST BE GREATER THAN ZERO !

t_max = None¶

the maximum t that the progress bar can display. MUST BE GREATER THAN ZERO !

block_interval = None¶

the time interval of each block. MUST BE GREATER THAN ZERO !

last_upper_t = None¶

the last upper t displayed by the progress bar

progress_mapping = None¶

a mapping to optimize the refresh rate

title = None¶

the title to write on the left side of the progress bar

block_character = None¶

the character to represent a block

uncomplete_character = None¶

the character to represent the uncompleted part of the progress bar
